metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14646 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 4.15-rc8 was found to be vulnerable to a NULLpointer dereference bug in the __netlink_ns_capable() function in thenet/netlink/af_netlink.c file. A local attacker could exploit this when anet namespace with a netnsid is assigned to cause a kernel panic and adenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-12.13~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required
